result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter HANG was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Wisconsin Crime Victim Compensation Fund.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Submit DNA sample.

Have no contact with Kieran McGrath.

timeConds.notes:
Four (4) months up front, under the Huber Law.   
Two (2) months stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 04-08-2016 @ 9:00 a.m.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-17-16 at 1:30 p.m.
Minutes.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is adjourned to 02-08-16 at 2:30 p.m. in Branch 2.
Notice to defendant.
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of substantial battery and disorderly conduct.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-25-16 at 2:30 p.m., Br. 1.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition defendant is to have no contact with Kieran McGrath or the Riverwalk Pub, Manitowoc.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
